intro: Petastoma discocalyx, commonly known as the white-flowered sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Petastoma discocalyx is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
